name: Robert Brown
text: I had a sudden schedule conflict come up with a group training I'm registered before. I've emailed, texted and called, and I can't get a response from anyone. It's extremely frustrating.

resp.text: Hi Robert - I just saw your message and responded. I will personally investigate this situation and we will do whatever we can to remedy it. Thank you for the feedback, and I apologize. Normally our students receive prompt responses from us, so I am not sure what happened.

name: Melissa Overhuel
text:
I first met Rebecca while looking for help with my puppy, Jango, who became leash reactive around 5 months old.  She is one of the most caring individuals I have ever met and very clearly cares about her students and their humans.  After working on my dog's reactivity we were able to go on and complete her entire training course offerings and she was very accommodating to my dogs special needs in regards to his reactivity.  I later adopted a deaf and neurogically impaired dog and she showed me the same level of accommodation to ensure that we could be as successful as possible.  I am a nurse and often had scheduling conflicts in order to complete our group lessons and Rebecca would often find a space in another group for us to make up our class or schedule a private lesson in order to ensure we recieved all of the instruction and skills we needed.
Rebecca and her team are all wonderful dog folks and the best in Birmingham as far as I am concerned.  I have said before and will always say that taking classes with LTTT was the best investment I could have ever made in my dogs.

resp.text: We all LOVE you, Jango, and Aayla!! I'm so glad that the training has benefited all of you. We miss you!

name: Cat Waselkov
text: We did several classes with both of our dogs and highly recommend LTTT. The puppy class was perfect for socializing and helping our puppy become more confident in navigating the world. The obedience and impulse control classes taught us so much about positive reinforcement-based training, and our relationship with our dogs benefitted immensely. Rebecca was also able to give us online private lessons to work on some additional tricks, allowing our younger dog to earn an AKC trick title. Rebecca really cares about each and every dog in the class, and we are so grateful that we found her. Rebecca was incredibly flexible about scheduling. We were able to do several classes despite me working full time and being in grad school.

resp.text: Thank you so much, I'm so so glad that you enjoyed your lessons as much as I enjoyed them with you guys! And I'm especially glad that we continued to be able to work together through the magic of the internet haha! Keep in touch!

name: Leslie Cak
text: I highly recommend the classes and trainers at Love Them, Train Them, LLC!! If you have an anxious puppy like I do, please take them to their Yappy Hour (a puppy socialization class) and Nervous Nellie (a confidence boosting class) classes and then keep signing up for classes and/or private training sessions because it is SO MUCH FUN to learn with your dog using positive reinforcement! Yuki (my almost year old Great Pyrenees) and I have had a blast with the awesome trainers at LTTT and I know you and your furbaby will too!

resp.text: Thank you so much Leslie! We have all enjoyed getting to work with you and Yuki and watching her grow up! Thank you for putting your trust in us all!

name: Peter Waselkov
text:
10/10 My dogs loved it and Rebecca is the best!

My dogs attended the first and second level basic training classes and had the best time. These are dogs that usually don’t listen to a word I say, yet still remember and follow the commands they learned in those classes.

One thing I really liked about Rebecca’s approach is that each week isn’t something totally new— it builds on the previous week’s progress. By the end, it seems like a massive behavioral improvement because of the gradual shaping of behavior over the course.

My spouse and I frequently had to trade off on who would take the dog to that week’s session, but Rebecca and her team were diligent with making sure we were using the proper commands learned on earlier weeks before progressing.

You’re not going to find a more caring and attentive group of people, and certainly not for such reasonable rates.

resp.text: Thank you so much Peter! I love those babies so much and wish that you guys still live here in town so we can continue our adventures further!

name: Aditi
text: While Rebecca is a fantastic trainer, a 6 week basic obedience class took 9 weeks to finish because of last minute cancellation/postponement notices from Rebecca. I would not go back as I fear my time will not be respected.

resp.text: I'm so sorry Aditi. As I discussed with you and your classmates, my father passed away during that time. I have never lost a parent so it was a very difficult time for me. I never miss a class unless it is due to something critical. Minnal did a wonderful job in beginner class, and I hope you will change your mind and return because I loved working with him and you guys. <3

name: Madison B
text: The best in Birmingham! I travel from 35 minutes out of town to bring my dogs to train with Rebecca! If you’re looking for a truly 100% positive reinforcement, fear-free and force-free trainer, this is it. My dog Gemma took the Impulse Control class and Rebecca was friendly, professional, knowledgeable, and kind. She is truly making a difference in improving dog-owner relationships and I’m so thankful to have found Love Them Train Them! My dog’s impulsive, hyper behavior has really improved with the training. They are also super responsive to emails and send training “homework” you can refer back to to keep practicing even after your classes end! I’ve already registered for the agility class with my other dog and can’t wait to start!

resp.text: Thank you so much Madison!! I ADORE Gemma and it has been so much fun getting to know you both! Keep up the good work and we'll see you soon!

name: Amber LeClaire
text: I've completed SEVERAL of Rebecca's training classes with my dogs. From puppy classes (great for socialization and bonding) to her more advanced classes (the most recent being for therapy work for my older dog who successfully completed his therapy dog certification, thanks to Rebecca's knowledge of the process and training involved). Rebecca really is a dog-whisperer. Not only is she great with your dog, she is great with YOU. My dogs are far quicker to catch on to commands than I am and Rebecca has infinite patience with me as she knows I sometimes get flustered when I feel I'm not doing something right. She is supportive and encouraging to both dog and handler. It is SO RARE to find that combination. Rebecca is a Birmingham treasure and her teaching methods are so wonderful and fun! I cannot recommend her and her Love Them, Train Them staff enough. ALL THE STARS!

resp.text: 💜 Wow, thank you Amber!! I am so very proud of you and your babies and all that you are accomplishing and will continue to accomplish!

name: Ivana Dill
text:
I can't say enough good things about Love Them Train Them LLC.  This review will be long but also describe my experiences so that people can get a good idea of the company. The first course I took with them was Impulse Control with my dog Arnold. He and I had completed beginner and intermediate obedience courses with another company.

We just happened to go to Love Them Train Them for Impulse Control because their schedule better matched ours at the time. Meredith Dempsey, is a great teacher to human and pup students.

We learned so much-got much more out of it than I ever dreamed. I decided to take Arnold to their tricks training course. They were very transparent that while they teach the how, not all dogs may be able or may want to do all of the tricks. The company emphasizes force free training and they follow through with this. HOWEVER,  the trainers, Rebecca (owner and trainer) and (Ally-trainer) made it so much fun that Arnold would come home and just offering to do tricks.

While we were taking the tricks training course, we ended up adopting a dog (Ginger) from a shelter. The trainers at this company had all worked with her at the shelter (she was being considered to become a fire dog at one point) and know of her excitability and energy levels. I mention that to mention that I chose to enroll her in beginner obedience.

Another company had evaluated her temperament for daycare purposes and considered Ginger reactive and unable to do daycare or interact with other dogs safely at the time. They suggested reactive dog training courses. Now, we already had Arnold. Arnold is pretty chill so I figured they would get along. For me, it was rough at the beginning because it was an adjustment for all of us and a first in regards to having a multi dog household.  It wasn't love at first sight but Ginger was not reactive towards Arnold.

I brought up my concerns with Love Them Train Them. Meredith suggested I get a second opinion regarding daycare and suggested a specific daycare. Ginger did very well and the staff at that daycare were quite surprised that I had been told Ginger needed reactive dog training before going to daycare.  Rebecca and Ally reassured me that Ginger has great learning abilities and that Anthony (the one currently teaching the beginner obedience course we are taking) would be excited to have us.

I reached out to Anthony before the course regarding the other company's thoughts as to Ginger being unable to take a beginner obedience course until a reactive course was taken. Anthony (who had worked with Ginger a good bit at the shelter-so I am sure that helped) told me he would make it work. And he has. The improvement in the past month has been incredible. Ginger does need a little more classroom modification that the other dogs but bit by bit, the modification is becoming less and Ginger is continuously improving. Even though Ginger already knew Anthony, watching him work with the other dogs has me fully convinced that even she hadn't know him, she would still do well.

During all of this, Ginger and Arnold had been getting used to each other. And me, used to having two dogs. Some things came up that caused me to question Arnold's and Ginger's capability of safely living together. But, when I reached out to Meredith (who knew and had worked with both dogs) she told me that both Arnold and Ginger are great communicators and to trust in my dogs' ability to communicate. This helped me to relax during their interactions (they love to play rough) which in turn helped them better enjoy others' company.

I could add so much more but in a nutshell: Love Them Train Them only uses force free methods, packs in a lot into one class, are willing and capable to work with what others may see as problematic, and their classes are fun!

resp.text: Wow! Thank you SO much for this great feedback, Ivana!! As you know, our entire team adores Arnold and Ginger! It is an honor to have you in class!! ❤ Thank you for entrusting us with their education!

name: Jeannie Bailey
text: Love the positive method of training and watching my dog learn and begin to know what I wanted without demands. No one wants them to lose their personality, just channel their energy into a positive direction. A great way to form a super bond with your dog!

resp.text: Aw, thank you Jeannie! We love having you and C man in class!

name: Tara Bugg
text: We took our 10 month old pit mix in for training. Mainly because she was regularly swallowing socks and nothing we tried worked to get her to drop them not swallow them. I had little faith this would make an impact. After the first class when we started with such simple basics I still didn't have faith. After the six weeks I will say I was so wrong. Everything our trainer taught us was great. In complete honesty we also didn't so our homework as diligently as we should have. The dog now readily knows stay, sit, touch, drop it, leave it, and come. She didn't do great on the tricks, but I wasn't worried about that and again we didn't work with her on those as much. She has gotten socks among other things and she now drops them or leaves them. I'm so thankful we did the class, I only wish we would've done it earlier. I would definitely recommend it!? Even our six year old dog started picking up on some of the good behaviors just from watching us work with her sister. Five stars!!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback, Tara! I am so glad things are going well for you guys at home! It makes me so happy to know that what you learned in class was helpful. ❤

name: Liz C.
text: These trainers have been such an amazing resource and support system for me and my dog! I'm really happy to continue training with them as he grows and I recommend them highly!! Give them a try and you'll see why their approach is top notch!

resp.text: Thank you Liz!! We are so happy to have you guys in classes with us.

name: Beth M
text: I enrolled my mixed lab at 8 weeks old, one day after I picked him up from Two by Two Rescue.  The class was for Basic Obedience Training.  Believe me, training starts at day 1.  You will be glad you did.  Meredith D. Is the best!

resp.text: She is SO the best! So glad you are enjoying class!!

name: David Marvin
text:
I have a very, very active 17 month old Lab who has been hard to control and loves to escape into the front yard to chase the neighbor's cats.  I normally have to get into my car and try to drive around and lure her in, hoping she does not get hit by a car.  This past Monday we finished a 6 week beginner obedience class with Meredith.

I was taking the trash out last night and went out the basement door next to where the cats hang out.  The trash bag hit the door and opened up and Willow ran out after the cats.  We have a very busy road and it is not a place for dogs to run around off the leash.  It is bad.

Instead of chasing her, I grabbed some bags and rattled them and started using high pitch come and touch commands that we learned in the class.  She came sprinting back and I went to grab her by the collar and it slid off!  She ran off to the other house up the street.  I was scared to death.  I remembered our training and was able to keep calm.  I went into the basement and grabbed her bag of dog food, rattled it, and gave the touch and come commands again in a high pitch, excited voice.  She sprinted back into the garage!! I closed the door and gave her a treat and praised her.

Thank you for making this possible!

resp.text: David, this makes my day!! Thank you so much for sharing!

name: Jessica Morris
text: Rebecca is the absolute BEST! I can’t say enough about her talent as a trainer, but also as a professional. I have taken her Tricks Class and have also had her to my house for personal training. She is kind and patient, and has the heart and passion, that sets her above the rest! I recommend her to anyone and everyone.

resp.text: Thank you so much Jessica!! It is my passion. Loved having you and Byrd in class!

name: Alison Johnston
text: We have worked with Rebecca  to complete Advanced Dog Training class and a Tricks Class.  She is a great teacher. She teaches you to teach and train  your pet.  She also is great about helping you understand your pet's reactions so that you can be the most effective trainer with your animal.  I highly recommend signing up for any and all of her classes.

resp.text: Thank you so much! I am so glad that you enjoyed the classes and that we have gotten to spend lots of time together in class over the years!

name: Casey Schaffer
text: AMAZING trainer! My Mulligan went through her advanced training with the goal of hopefully being able to pass the REALLY hard Hand in Paw therapy dog test. Thanks to all of her hard work he passed with flying colors! I can't wait until I can get my younger golden in her class so he too can hopefully become a  therapy dog and follow in his brother's footsteps.

resp.text: Thank you Casey. It meant so much to me that you entrusted me with Mulligan's "continuing ed."

name: David Jones
text: I participated in Rebecca's beginner course and it was great for my dog and myself.  The training is based on positive reinforcement and the course covered the basic commands and behaviors we needed to get started.  In addition, Rebecca was really good at providing written materials to set out what the course would cover and then to reinforce each of the classes with exercises to do outside of class.

resp.text: Thank you David! You and Smokey are a great team!

name: Kimberly Scrushy
text: No better trainer than Rebecca. I can never repay her for the happiness she has brought to our lives. The puppy classes have given us the ability to enjoy learning WITH our puppies. Learning is fun for all involved and no family member is ever left out. The positive reinforcement training has brought a quality of life we never could have imagined. Life with our puppy is completely stress free thanks to this wonderful trainer and her fun classes.

resp.text: Wow, thank you Kimberly! That is high praise. You know I love that Harley girl!

name: Lea Davis
text: I have taken three dogs to work with Rebecca over several years. She has always given my dogs the best attention and training. I do and will continue to recommend her as a trainer. She works wonders in a few sessions.

resp.text: Thank you, Lea!! Loved having you guys in class with me.

name: Anthony Rodriguez - UA
text: Just completed Rebecca's basic obedience course, and I can't say enough great things about her or the course. From day 1 my dog was showing signs of improvement. Also I was able to learn everything needed to continue the training outside class. I highly recommend any course Rebecca offers for dogs of all ages. Mine was 6 and easily picked up on the tasks. Looking forward to Impulse Control Training :)

resp.text: Thank you, Anthony! I am so glad you have enjoyed class and that Molly is improving!

name: Hunter Youngblood
text: Every dog I’ve owned has gone through Rebbeca and I love here! She is a phenomenal trainer and has a great group!!

resp.text: Thank you Hunter! I love working with y'all!!

name: Natalie Daniel
text: Rebecca and Emily are wonderful!! They are very knowledgable about training and make the learning process very fun! They have helped our two labs so much! They both have a basic understanding of simple commands such as sit, stay, down, wait, leave it, touch, watch, and leash walking. I recommend them to all dog owners!

name: Staci Galey
text: Rebecca is one of the friendliest people you will ever have the pleasure of doing business with. She was able to help me house train a dog I had rescused, that I thought was a lost cause. Highly recommend.

name: Karen Haberland
text: I've taken Gibbs, our high-energy pug mix puppy to Rebecca for both basic obedience and impulse control. She is a wonderful trainer that only uses positive reinforcements methods. With her help Gibbs has transformed from a crazy baby to a beloved family member. We'll be going back to Rebecca soon for Tricks class and Therapy Prep.

resp.text: Thank you Karen. Gibbs is a cutie pie and has grown so much in his abilities! So proud of the hard work you guys are putting in.

name: Chanley Whitcomb
text: My 5 month old Siberian Husky, Izzy, my husband, and I all participated in Rebecca's class beginner class and had an absolute blast! We all looked forward to our fun "school time" every week and were amazed at how fast Izzy picked up skills using Rebeccas techniques. For quite possibly, the worlds most hyper pup, Rebecca worked absolute magic! We are already signed up for the next session of classes, "impulse control" and are so looking forward to it!

name: J Dailey
text: I've know Rebecca several years she is very personable & knowledgeable training puppies & dogs.  I have taken multiple dogs to her for class.  By now you would think I could train my own dogs, and I could but Rebecca keeps up to date with the do's and don'ts and I ALWAYS come away with something new.  Going to class also makes me get up and go instead of putting it off.  I don't like my puppies/dogs to jump up on me or anyone else, nip or any other bad habits that CAN be corrected.  I have taken puppies and grown dogs and I wouldn't go to anyone else to train my dogs.

resp.text: Thank you Jan!! You were always one of my best students (aka "frequent flyers"). Can't wait to see you back this spring!

name: Lindi Pearson
text: Wonderful play groups and boarding. Great staff and always willing to give me reports no matter how many times I call to check up on the puppies. Highly recommend

name: Jennifer Horn
text:
CDT isn't our normal boarder, but i almost effed up Thanksgiving by forgetting to schedule Jackie to board. Creative Dog Training came through for us!

I couldn't believe they had room! And when we got there, they were SO NICE. Oh my gosh, i can't remember her name, but she was tiny & had dark hair like me. She was really able to make me feel confident about leaving him in their care.

Jack was having some hotspot issues, so she took his medicine & told me they keep a close eye on him. They also were able to put him in a play group for older dogs, which they posted pictures on Facebook every day! They also didn't care that I'm a helicopter dog mom & called every day to check. =)

I was so excited, i burst through the door at the facility & announced i was there to pick up my dog. (I also may have done a little dance.) The little girl from before said Jackie's name before i even got a chance to! They really know & care about their clients!

Also, when i picked him up, they'd been taking such great care of his hotspots, they were almost totally resolved!! =O

11/10 experience, will DEFINITELY board there again!

name: Keith M
text: Fantastic facility and knowledgeable staff.  They really work well with teaching us and especially our kids.  Can't say enough positive things about this place.  It's the only place to go for dog obedience.

name: Rebecca Whitaker
text: I took my dog here for a class lesson and Mrs. Margaret was absolutely wonderful. She made the lesson easy and fun for my children and has certainly made a difference in my dog. She has a way with training not only dogs, but owners too! I would recommend Creative to anyone!

name: Madison Mindler
text:
The absolute best place in town!! I have worked here since 2016 and can only say great things. We take care of every dog like they are our own and have absolutely nothing to hide. You can come in anytime for a tour, talk to a client advisor, trainer, or supervisor. Every person has a passion for dogs and a drive to make Cdt the absolute best. I can’t dream of a better job and watching clients go home happy with their pup
Is the best feeling ever!!

name: pitna kim
text: My dog loves to go CDT and he seems like too much fun every visit :)

name: Shades Creek Dental Patient Centered Care
text: I can not say enough about creative dog training! Our dog Sandy is always excited to go and play and comes home exhausted from all of the fun. The staff are clearly all animal lovers and take great care of your pets.  Also, if your pet needs any vet care, they work with a vet a couple doors down to take your pet back and forth for appointments! Thanks!

name: Amanda WR
text: They were nice enough at the counter but when we picked our dog up, her paws and legs were soaked in urine and she was filthy. Our backseat had to be professionally cleaned to get the smell out. I don't know how they let the dogs get like that, perhaps not cleaning the play area well. Anyway, I called them and left a voicemail about this and never heard back.

name: chris collins
text: Creative Dog Training is awesome. We bring our dog every Monday for continuing training and play time. He comes home smarter, tired, and happy as ever. We love our friends at Creative.

name: Lucy Phillips
text: Highly recommend Creative Dog Training! They have done a fabulous job training my Siberian Husky and she LOVES doggie daycare! She’s always exhausted when she gets home!

name: DeKayla Sankey
text: Very poor customer service. You have to consistently pester and call them, only to have them take down your name and number with a very empty promise to get back with you. THEY NEVER DO. I have been calling for a week straight and my problem still has not been resolved, but everytime I call they tell me how sorry they are. Tuh. I am a paying customer and feel very undervalued. I’ve been more than patient with them, but at this point I just want what I paid for, so I can be done with them. I will not be returning.

name: Everything Bham
text: The owner and staff really care about you and your animals!  Never have had a bad experience! One of the best family owned businesses in bham! I believe in Birmingham!!

name: Lori Goldberg
text:
Do NOT take your dogs here!
This place is not sanitary. The workers leave dogs in pee and poop filled kennels for hours before they are cleaned.
The dogs don't go outside from 4pm to 7am the next day.
They have had 2 cases of kennel cough since spring break, and have still been using the same sponge to clean all of the dog bowls.
If your dog is having a health issue while boarding, the workers will not tell you about it if they don't think it's serious. There are dogs who get incredibly sick either from stress or other health problems that result in blood in the vomit and/or stool. The only thing they do is take the dogs food and water away and don't let them outside.
The dogs water bowls are only checked at 7am and then again at 4pm. So your dog may be going without water for any number of hours between those times and the workers will ignore it. The bowls are only cleaned once per day, so if your dog is boarding for several days, there's a very good chance that they'll have the same bowl of water over the course of their stay. They have a major rat problem there, so often times there is rat feces in the water bowls.
The dogs are left alone all night with the rats, which your dogs could be eating over night, making them very sick and possibly catching diseases.
The workers do not have first aid training, so if your dog chokes on the mulch that is outside in the play area, then they are told to "look up an instructional video" to help the choking dog.
They don't pay attention to what the dogs are doing because they're too busy on their phones to care. So if your dog poops mulch (very bad for his digestive system) then it's because they were eating it from the play area. There are also several dogs who eat poop, so if your dog has that habit, it's probably only getting worse because they think they're allowed to do it while staying there.
When the dogs are playing outside, they are sometimes not given water for several hours due to certain dogs not liking the water hose.
I have witnessed a coworker giving the wrong dog her medicine. Once that realization was made, still nothing was done about it.
If your dog is not good with other dogs, they are set as "individuals" where they play by themselves. These dogs are only getting 10 minutes outside to play, and then they get 10 minutes inside to play. They are supposed to have another 10 minutes to play but are usually skipped because the workers want to go home early. So if your dog is boarding over the weekend and they're not good with other dogs, then they're only getting about 20 minutes of outside time every day while the other dogs get over 2 hours.
The weekend hours are different, so all of the play groups are shortened and the dogs are left alone for a lot longer than they normally would be.
Their medicine is put in pill pockets in their food. If the dog doesn't voluntarily eat the pill pockets, then that dog will not be getting their medicine that day.
The dogs only have access to their food for a couple hours a day. So if your dog is a grazer and doesn't eat all of their food at once then they will be eating very little over the course of their stay.
The kennels are painted very poorly, paint is always chipping off the walls, usually because dogs are chewing it off.
Workers regularly spray dogs in the face with Bitter Apple spray. This spray is supposed to be used for dogs that have problems chewing their fur, and is not meant to be sprayed in the eyes or nose of the dogs, but they are regularly sprayed in the face if they are barking in their kennels.
If you request for your dog to be given a bath, they will usually bathe the dogs very early in the day to get it out of the way. Once they're bathed, they are not allowed back outside and their food and water bowls are taken away. So if you dropped your dog off at 8am to be picked up around 5pm, there's a good chance that your dog hasn't been outside or had food or water since about 10am.

resp.text:
Hi Lori, I wanted to reply here as well since I did not hear back from you regarding this same review you left on Facebook.
I'm truly sorry this is how you felt about working at CDT.

As one of the owners, and the person responsible for systems management in the locations I am very upset to hear these things. I'm also very concerned that not once had myself or any of the owners been contacted or told any of these things throughout the course of your employment there.

Because I can assure you, that not one thing you have said is company policy or are reflective of our systems we've built over 40 years.

There's nothing I can say to refute your claims because you cannot prove a negative, all I can say is that if you truly felt this way you should have come directly to myself, Margaret or Damian the multiple times we are all there per day whether helping out, working on things or just leaving our own dogs there for boarding or daycare.

At the end of the day, I'm sorry you feel this way about CDT. We have been doing this for over 40 years at this point, and have thousands of satisfied clients and dogs that I would hope reflect otherwise. If you would like to talk further or share specifics please send me a message because I would like to know details so I can address anything possible.

name: Daryl Mote
text: I’m glad that I checked on here for reviews before scheduling. The owners responses on here to previous employees are very unprofessional, very telling, and honestly, a complete turn off. You ALMOST had my hard earned money.

name: Lorace Merriweather
text: Troy S (owner) and staff are top notch. They were 100% receptive to install changes after some miscommunication on my part on where we initially want the invisible fence barrier to run. Very happy with product my young dogs (10 & 9 months) caught on very quickly (3 days) on good and bad places to go with no leash. No more running after rabbits , dogs aren't hurt but they hear the tone alert before the buzz and turn back. No more chasing dogs around neighborhood if they slip out the door behind kids (as long as invisible collar is on).

name: rcwann1
text:
Our Invicible Fence has been a significant asset to our family and to the quality of our dogs life. Though my wife and I wanted to allow our two boxers access to our entire yard we really did not want to put up a traditional fence which would reduce the openness of our property. The Invisible Fence provided us the solution we needed. Our dogs now have access to the front and back yard and don't have to be let outside on a leash. We decided to have our fence separate the front yard from the back as there are times when we don't want our dogs in the front yard. This has worked out great and I'm glad we chose this option. Additionally, we had the fence section off a portion of our yard for a vegetable/flower garden. We did not do this at first but we just couldn't keep the dogs out so after a year or two we had Invisible Fence come back out and run a fence around our garden...problem solved.
As far as the quality of the product, in the 10 years we've had the fence the only issue we had to call about was my fault. I ran a plow to close to the fence and severed it. Fortunately it was a quick repair as the technician has the equipment to find the severed line quickly.
One final point, my impression of Invisible Fence of Huntsville's owner, Troy, is that he has a genuine passion and understanding of dogs which allowed my wife and I to comfortably follow his suggestions. After over 10 years of using the Invisible Fence of Huntsville myself, nor my wife, have any reservations recommending this business to family and friends.

name: Hillary Arcocha
text:
Invisible Fence has been a life saver for our three dogs! When we first moved into our house, we were concerned with how to contain our curious, fence jumping hound, Hannibal. Our yard isn't really set up well for a physical fence, plus the escape artist has a 6 foot vertical jump so it just wasn't practical. We found Invisible Fence at a home and garden show and later called to have them come out and give a quote. A week later we had our invisible fence installed and began training the hound! Troy (and Jack Fate) is great at working with excitable dogs and spent a good amount of time working with Hannibal on the first visit. It went so well we only needed the one training session and Hannibal knew where the boundaries were and not to run. When we acquired two more dogs, we had them added to the fence and again training went great. Our neurotic Jack Russell puppy had it figured out in two days which is the fastest she's learned anything, and our Shitzhu had it down pat in 10 minutes. Both are chronic runners if they get the chance so it's a relief to know they will stay in the yard now.

Any time I need batteries, I can call the office or contact Troy and he'll either drop them off if he's in the area or I pick them up just a few miles from my house, usually the same day. That's a huge convenience for me, and a life saver when batteries suddenly die! Everybody I've worked/spoken with at Invisible Fence has been delightfully helpful and pleasant, I highly recommend them especially for escapist dogs.

name: Miles Cantrall
text: OK, it has been one week since Troy installed our invisible fence and I am writing my review.   I wanted to wait a full week because I had my doubts that it would work with my two two year old Doberman Pinschers.  Troy said it would, as well as work for our older untrained and UNTRAINABLE Shih Tsu!  I had my doubts, especially as one of the Dobies doesn't like bicycles after having been run over by a bicyclist.   We had paid Lowes to install a fence in part of our yard only to discover it was going to take almost 90 days for them to install it.  We called Troy after about 2 months and he said he could fence our entire yard in about a week, at much less than what we had paid Lowes.  Following rhe instructions Troy gave us we had all three dogs off leashes on day 2.   The dogs are happier having the run of almost our entire yard where we had originally planned to only fence 1/4 of it.  Best of all, when Troy came back for follow up training, he brought little discs that we put on either side of our kitchen island and set them so the Shih Tsu could pass through yet the Dobies are blocked.  No longer must we prepare meals while the Dobies hangout in the kitchen trying to eat our dinner before we do.  Better still, we put a disc just inside our daughter's bedroom door to keep the Dobies out so the cat isn't bothered by them and has a safe place.  Oh.....and we have a swampy section that runs across the backyard.   Troy waded through it doing the installation.  Snakes, what snakes?   The system works beautifully and the dogs and the humans are all much less stressed.   I whole heartedly recommend Troy and his Invisible Fence company.

resp.text:

Thank you for taking the time to review Invisible Fence of Huntsville's products and services. Your pack was a pleasure to work with!!!

You have a great property and glad we let the dogs have maximum coverage of their area including the pond!!!

text:
I have been an owner of Invisible Fence for over 10 yrs. I have always been impressed with the Customer Service we get from Troy. Whether it be a new battery or just a question about the system, he always takes care of us without delay.

Today we experienced the Lifetime Warranty guarantee in action. After 10 years of great service, it was finally time for a needed replacement. Troy was at my house the very next day after my call and took care of our needs.

Thank you, Troy, for making Invisible Fence the right choice for us and our dog Smoky. It has allowed him to have the freedom of the outdoors, and you have made Customer Service a definite 5 star!

name: Cindy Jones
text: I have had underground fencing in the past but was very disappointed in the service after installation. The system did not keep my dogs in. That was several years ago. After neighbors complaining about my German shepherd I had to do something. After reading the reviews on this company I decided to give it another shot. Troy was fantastic!  He came out when he said he would, thoroughly explained everything about this fencing and how it works.  We scheduled the install for the following week. He arrived on a Friday and worked with the dogs first. By Monday when he returned for a follow up I was able to let both dogs off leash and they stayed in the yard. If I could I would give him 10 stars!!

resp.text:
Hi Cindy,

You, Lucy and Rocky were a pleasure to work with.  We appreciate your business and the opportunity to serve you!  Also, appreciate you taking the chance with Invisible Fence Brand - our Boundary Plus technology, Perfect Start Plus Training protocol and Customer Service are what set us apart from other companies.

Troy
Invisible Fence of Huntsville

name: Melissa Terry
text: I have never been so happy with a product and customer service combined. It’s been six months since we purchased our invisible fence and our dog has become so much better behaved both inside and outside. Troy and his staff were infinitely patient and came back as much as it took to train my dog and then the puppy we adopted. Luckily for them,  it didn’t take too long. :)  The fence ended up being a selling point when we went to sell our home and we were able to take the main box and collars with us to our new house where we immediately got another invisible fence. I will never have a house without one again.  Call Troy! You  and your pups will love him just like we do!

resp.text:
Hi Terry,
We appreciate you taking the time to review our product and services.  Your growing pack was a pleasure to work with.  Thank you for your business.  We are grateful for the opportunity to serve you.
Troy

text:

When Troy came out to look at my yard and to get to know our precious doggies. I expected him to show up to  look, quote and leave. Instead he got to know our dogs' personalities and got to know me! He took time out to sit in our yard and really work with our dogs. He gave me lots of information and was available whenever I needed him. Troy is not just here to sell a product, but he is here because he is a true animal lover! Invisible fence is a great product and I'm glad that they have Troy representing them!

name: lenita davis
text:
What a game changer it was by installing an invisible fence for our dog, Max.  Max is a one year old Border Collie.  It had become increasingly unfair to him to be confined to a small space.  Up until a month ago, Max's options were limited to being in the house or waiting for us to come home to let him out and play.

We finally decided to call Invisible Fence of Huntsville.  Troy came out and to meet Max and us and completed an initial assessment. He is so personable, professional, and most of all kind.  Max really liked him.  Troy took great with Max.  From our conversations, you knew that Troy is passionate about his work with animals.

The following week, Troy returned for the fence installation.  We marked off the area and he went to work.  From start to finish, it took four hours which included the first dog training (e.g. adjusting the sensation,  reassuring  Max.)Troy returned several days later for the last dog lesson.   By then, Max was acclimated to his new found freedom.  He understood the boundaries and how far he could push before he was "corrected"!  He was now free to frolic, play, and "herd".  There was also an immediate impact to my family.  We were regimented to take Max out a specific times... and no-one wanted to take him out at night, in the cold or the rain!  All we have to do now is open door. Max takes care of the rest!  Moreover, there were no accidents in the house to clean.

We strongly and highly recommend Troy and Invisible Fence of Huntsville.  We appreciate you!

name: Frantina Wilson
text: I have to say I had heard negative things about Piper's from friends, but I continued to use them because we had always had good experiences with them. However, I really can't give Piper's a good review after my 4 babies latest visit over Thanksgiving weekend. We took more than enough of everything that our 2 dogs and 2 cats would need for a stay that spanned from Wednesday night - Sunday night. When we picked them up and got home we noticed left over food for the dogs, we took separate bags for each dog for each day, so was there a day that the dogs were not fed. In addition, MOST of the food we took for the cats was still in the bag...that concerns me as well. My 18 month old cat came home extremely jittery and has been jumping at the slightest noise. I can't say that Piper's did anything wrong, but I will say that our furbies did not come home happy this time. The cats will probably never go back and I will have to think long and hard about taking the dogs back too. The staff, as always, was great in their interactions with me.

text: Our family dog is well-behaved for our crew that includes 3 kids ages 5-11. He loves to fetch baseballs, run, play, and frolic in the occasional Alabama snowfalls but he doesn't get out to socialize often with other people or dogs, so he can act territorially aggressive when kenneled once or twice a year. We've kenneled him other places before, but he came home the happiest when we used Piper's. He came home clean and happy, and the staff seemed upbeat and positive both at drop-off and pick-up. I know he's likely not the most easygoing dog for which they provide services, but our family appreciates them for their professionalism and care.

resp.text: Thank you for the wonderful review! We can't wait until Homer comes to see us again!

text: I have three hyper-active brindled rescued dogs that absolutely love this place, they begin going nuts when we are still blocks away. I cannot begin to express my gratitude to the wonderful people who work there for giving me peace of mind while I am away. I highly recommend entrusting your pet with these wonderful people for all of your pet care needs.

text: My pup has been going to pipers for almost 3 years now. Even though my pup started daycare at an early age she isnt very social towards other dogs. However she isnt aggressive. The staff at pipers recognized this right away and made accommodations to make her feel safe. While she is visiting she is allowed a safe place to withdraw when the interaction of other dogs is just too much. At the same time she has just as much freedom to join the group and observe or if she is in a really good mood play! The fact that they treat each dog according to each dogs personality and temperament speaks volumes! It is above and beyond and average doggie daycare! My pup is always excited to go to day care! She starts crying from excitement as soon as we turn off quintard. She is always extremely excited to see the staff, especially Alisha! 😉 (her second mom) Thank you to Alisha, Shannon, and all the Pipers staff for 3 years of great service!! 💖🐶

name: Jennifer Jackson
text: My fur babies look so awesome after their visit and the staff is wonderful. Found my new groomers

name: Erin Calvert
text:
This local Dog establishment is violating multiple heath codes. The owner of this facility and the manager were told on multiple occasions by employees and were aware of the following: Fire extinguishers (they only have 2) being extremely out of date, last checked back in 2015— also no evacuation plan, or safety drills, air vent maintenance doesn’t take place— vents/filters not properly maintained can easily catch fire, this company works with LIVE animals, the safety of your dogs are not being considered as you can tell from the images.... everything is layered with years of dog dander and hair.
When the heater gets turned on the smell of burning hair lasts for days and the company uses wax melts up front to mask the smells. They also stuff the vents they don’t clean with smell good beads to mask the smell.
Even daycare dogs are kenneled. Employees hang around upfront until around 9 when they decide to start putting dogs in daycare—- this means if you’re paying for a full day or even a half day of doggie daycare starting in the morning your furbabies are missing out on 2+ hours of socialization. This facility doesn’t properly clean the daycare room. And weeks worth of hair is noticeable near the drains in the daycare play areas, this is extremely unsafe for your animals/the employees. The smell in this building that’s separate from the building your drop off your dog is horrific. Dogs are left unsupervised in daycare, and the daycare supervision in maintained outside of the daycare rooms- so instead of dogs getting that one-on-one attention they are only monitored when barking has increased. Because of that, rooms aren’t cleaned right away causing burns on paw pads from dogs playing around in urine. Most dogs have to be ran through Grooming to be spot cleaned before leaving. Bored dogs have started eating the walls of this establishment because of the lack of social interaction they receive. This facility illegally mentioned to employees that they can not pay overtime to them when they have worked 40+ hrs. Because of this, I believe the care of the animals that go there are being affected.
During the recent snow storm an employee managed to chase a already nervous dog around the front lobby of this establishment causing him to run out of the front door. This dog was missing for a week and found with his hip shattered, and he had ate an entire toe off of himself.. this establishment paid his vet bill which included the cost of utilization. Clearly the proper training of employees is not being conducted. This facility also does not clean kennels often and when they do they use a dirty mop to wipe out the kennels. This is probably a factor to the outbreak of kennel cough they are currently battling.
Many times employees just feed  dogs breakfast without even bothering to clean the kennel first or move the dog to a clean kennel.. that means that they were eating breakfast in their own filth and kenneled with it until daycare started up. In It’s hard enough trusting someone, let along finding out an establishment you’re paying LOTS of money to is neglecting your animal. This establishment recently caused the death of a small 4 lb dog, and they are trying to cover it up. By deleting comments and blocking any negativity they receive. I refuse to be silent. This facility is anything but transparent!!!

name: Shannon gilmore
text: I wouldn't take my two babies anywhere else!! They love everyone there! My oldest dog is nervous around strangers and he doesn't hesitate to run up to everyone there. The groomer is amazing and I have never been disappointed. I have a 6 year old male dorkie (dachshund/Yorkshire terrier) and a 1 year old female schnorkie (schnauzer/Yorkshire terrier), who are both rescues. I recommend pipers to everyone

I would bring her back because for the first time in 6 years I didn't worry about picking my dog up and them being under stress, no walked enough, kept in a crate all day, or not being checked on plenty.

Thanks to piper's dogowners can rest easy knowing their pups are being pampered to the fullest in a clean environment!

I even called and ask if my lab could stay one more day one the day I was supposed to pick her up from our trip and they were happy to let her stay in her room!

Piper's also holds drives for the the local animal shelters at least once a year to help in that aspect. Piper's Rescue a

text: Piper's Playhouse has been a lifesaver!!! We recently got a very sweet but very high energy rescue...Smokey:)  They were not scared off by his hyper-self and have been a wonderful help in helping me make his entrances and exits not so wild LOL;). I live and work in Gadsden so add 3 hrs and 140 miles to each work day for Smokey to go there...it's worth all that extra effort bc I know he is well taken care of(they welcome me calling to check on him), having fun, and will be toast when I pick him up, which makes nights much more manageable;). This place of business is clean, professional, helpful, loving, and a blessing for dogs and dog owners!!!

name: Kate Upchurch
text: Prior to this past visit I'd have written a great review but when I picked my little guy  ( a shih tzu )up on Christmas Eve I was horrified! Shaking, limping and handed dirty bedding with no explanation as to how he was injured, why we weren't informed  when it happened plus finding out he'd been very stressed by being kenneled every night in the large room with the large dogs with big dog barks! When I first boarded @ Piper's 2 years ago I requested that he be kenneled at night with only little dogs and was shown a room off the hall on the right where I was told the small dogs stayed. When I asked why he was put in the big room this time with the big dogs she said "well, you didn't request that he be separated". If my file had been consulted I'm sure it would reflect my wishes. There was no I'm sorry we didn't contact you about his injury, etc. He literally had to be carried that night and Christmas day every time to potty, to food bowl, etc. While I understand this may not be the norm @ Piper's, ( had never happened to me before) since it happened this time, I'll be making other arrangements next time. Beware. Things are not always as they seem. Ask to see where your dog will be put at night. I was told they  NEVER allow tours! That's shocking! I've ALWAYS toured where I board my dog. Ask what their policy is if your dog becomes injured or sick. I asked when the owner would be there as I wanted to speak in person with them and was told the owner was never at the Anniston location. Really? So, I've emailed the owner to express my concerns.

name: Wilson, Brandon David
text: To fire one on leave seem real... despicable. More care is given to pups than those mental. If you've paid the piper you know who I am. The management's a joke, but current employees are grand.

name: Leisa Cole

Also I would like to add with being a former employee of Pipers Playhouse. Know that your baby is well watched and takenjoy care of. Thank you for such a great experience James and Liz.

name: Brittany Stephens
text:
My dog began daycare at JHH at approximately 6 months old and attended at least 2-3 times per week. I always thought she enjoyed it as she seemed excited to pull up and be dropped off. At around a year old, I started noticing a lot of staff turnover at the facility. Although I should have taken heed, I did not and my dog continued to attend day care regularly. I began noticing that my dog was very timid of the staff. In particular, she was called by one of the managers/trainers and immediately backed up, tail between her legs, and laid down in a submissive position behind me. This time I took note and my dog never returned to the facility. I still have pre-paid day care days that will go unused. When I inquired about my dog’s reaction, it was explained to me by staff that my dog was regularly kept separate in a kennel in the back during the day. AND, that her “training” involved being taken into the yard, on a leash, while other dogs were allowed to approach her and she was given commands to obey. THIS RUINED MY DOG. She has dog aggression issues to this day, largely due to her extreme anxiety which I believe was engrained into her at a developmental stage while at JHH. Please do not take your dog to this facility for daycare.

Also, please note that most of the favorable reviews were posted at least a year ago. While the more recent reviews question the dogs well-being at the facility.

name: Emma Tolbert
text: Terrible! I paid $74 per night for my 2 senior-age shelties to be boarded in the “Beach House” suite while I was out of town. When they were picked up they were soaking wet and filthy, as if they had been left outside in the rain. They were also hungry, and an excess of their food was left that should not have been if instructions were followed. Definitely would not recommend if you are looking for your pets to be well taken care of!

name: Christina Fortugno
text: Just Happy Hounds needs to be your first and last look at daycare for your best friend. I moved to Birmingham a few months ago and did not know a soul. I came for graduate school with my best friend (Oliver) and the center of my world. I shopped around for daycares like my peers do for their human children. I chose Just Happy Hounds because the staff was friendly and I loved how my dog was always playing. He does not spend hours alone in a kennel like he would at home. They have far exceeded my expectation for customer service and outright exceptional care for my puppy. Oliver had a scratched cornea from playing a little hard and required surgery. I was stressed about what to do. I thought I could not take him to daycare while he recovered for surgery. He required extensive medications and needed to watched more closely in the cone of shame. The JHH team took care of Oliver post-op just as well as I would have at home. I never have to worry about my best friend while I am at work/class all day. I know he is being loved and played with as he is at home. I could not be more thankful for such incredible care of Oliver during his time of extra need. As a nurse, I am always caring for everyone else. I have been incredibly thankful to have someone help me out and give me peace of mind. Never bring your baby somewhere else! Sarah and her team are incredible. JHH is the best home away from home you can bring you furry friend to.

Very friendly staff however the groom on my Pomeranian wasn't quite up to snuff. I took him in at the end of March 2017 for an all over trim down to 1/2" (tail included), specific attention to his ears, and a sanitary cut.
The overall cut was uneven around his face, legs, and tail - it looked chunky, spots were missed and others cut too short. The sanitary cut was what I asked for but I noticed a razor burn/cut on the inside of his leg after we got home. They did a great job on his ears which is usually a tough spot so it seems odd that the other stuff was so spotty.
This groomer just doesn't seem to have the skill for my dog's coat or their prices. We won't be going back.

name: Tim Cadran
text: While we've only had one visit thus far, it was an extremely positive one. Theresa took the time to learn about our goals and what we wanted to get out of the training, and then explained how we could achieve that through her program. We learned a lot in day 1 and did a lot of hands on training. She will be sending us our training schedule this evening and we already have our next in-person session scheduled 4 weeks from now. we have a long way to go, but we will confident that with Theresa's guidance, we can get there.

resp.text: Thank you Tim. You guys did great today with Bruno. I'm looking forward to our next visit!

name: meagan lord
text:
Our dog, Piper, was a completely different dog in just the few hours that Theresa was in our home. Having a less stressed dog who listens and knows who is in charge is going to make a world of difference in our home. In just a few hours, she was responding so different than what we have been used to for the last six months. We were at our wits end with her behaviors and in the few hours Theresa was here to help me work with her I could tell a difference in her anxiety level and her behavior. I was able to go in my kitchen without a dog under my feet, answer the door without her coming too, walk her on a loose leash without her pulling in front of me. The results were amazing. Theresa will be back in a month and we will continue to work with her everyday at home to see a dramatic difference in our sweet dog. After a few hours of training she is worn out and sleeping peacefully in our living room, which would have never happened before.

I am so glad we sought some extra help with Theresa from BarkBusters! We truly couldn’t have done it without her. She is so patient and kind. We never would have gotten this with other forms of training we looked into!

resp.text: Thank You Meagan. I enjoyed working with you and Piper. She is a very sweet girl and wants to please you.

name: Brittany Howard
text:
Theresa has been working with my sister and her dog, Sophie, for over a month now and the experience has been great. We saw tremendous improvements in Sophie's behavior after just the first session, and over the next month it continued to improve. Sophie has developed anxiety and we're still working on keeping her calm when neighbors walk past the apartment, but when something hasn't worked, Theresa has always had another method to try.

We chose to work with Bark Busters because they claim to use positive reinforcement and better communication rather other less pleasant methods like shock collars. Sophie is a sweet dog who has a strong bond with us and we didn't want to hit or mistreat her. Theresa shares that mindset and the Bark Busters methods really have deepened our bond with Sophie.

I also really appreciated that Theresa invited me to attend the training sessions even though Sophie belongs to my sister and my sister is paying for the training (not me). But because I keep Sophie during the day while my sister is at work, Theresa knew I would be spending a lot of time with Sophie. Consistency is really important to make these techniques work, and having attended the training sessions, I can work with Sophie at home during the day, which has helped our progress.

Finally, lots of people claim to love dogs, but you can tell quickly that Theresa really does care about the clients she works with. If something isn't working, she doesn't force it. She's patient and she tries to tailor what she does to the dog and family she works with. Working with her has been a great investment.

resp.text: Thank you Brittany. Sophie is a sweet dog. We will keep working on her till she is happy and you guys too.

name: Ali Brown
text: I hired Theresa to help with my rescued dog, Oscar whose fear and anxiety led him to biting. name: Chris Kearns
text:
Theresa came highly recommended by the Lee County Humane Society when I asked them for help with our family dog that had bitten one of the children.  After we decided to work together, she sent me some information to get me prepared for our first meeting.  Even though she was greeted at the door with loud barks and bared teeth, she kept her cool and within about 1 hour he was eating out of her hand.  I was impressed, but the real work was yet to come.

She walked me through several different exercises/activities to recondition his behavior and train me to set the tone for what was expected in the house and out on walks, and gave me some equipment to use while training.  While neither I nor Bodie were perfect right away, the progress was astounding.  She recapped each of the activities with me before she left, and I felt very confident in 6 or 7 of the 8, but that's ok.  Part of the package she sent me later was a detailed action plan for the first 4 weeks, including a checklist for the daily activities we are supposed to practice, and a reminder on what I was supposed to do with each one.  OK!

Even now just a day or two after Theresa has started with us, this dog is the best behaved it's ever been. He used to bark in my face every time I would get dressed because he knew I was going out somewhere and there was a chance he could go on a car ride or a walk.  He also used to crowd me in the kitchen while I was making dinner or getting his food ready or his treats ready.  But one of the early things she taught me was how to hold a space in the kitchen to work when I want, and to let him in during normal times.  I decided to test that right after she left by making myself a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. Normally when he smelled peanut butter he was *right in there* hoping to get some for himself but this time he stood patiently about six feet away, and just watched until I called him and I was finished. It was the same thing for filling his food bowls and stuffing his toys with treats. Amazing!!  I cannot tell you how much more enjoyable it is to get dressed in the morning and come downstairs and put my shoes on and have a breakfast without a dog barking in my face the whole time because he expects to go for a walk or go for a ride.  He's still there next to me happy as ever, he's just not barking!

We're still working on the "loose leash" walking techniques, and it seems weird to have to correct him all the time instead of letting him wander around, but he's starting to figure it out, and that means less corrections.  Honestly it's better exercise for both of us when he does it correctly because we keep a good pace. He still gets to pee and poop and enjoy the outside, but we actually get moving well enough to get some real exercise, and it's much more enjoyable and less strain my back if he's not pulling the whole time.

I'm excited to see how far Bodie and I can take this training, we're both learning at the same time.  I feel like I made the right decision to hire Theresa with Bark Busters, and I look forward to showing her how much progress we've made by the next time we all get together.  Thank you for making my dog more fun to be around, and safer too.  I can't tell you how much it means, but you saw it on my face.  I WISH we had done something like this earlier.

If your dog is running your house, and/or sometimes out of your control, please do something about it - call Theresa and get some help.

resp.text: Thank you Chris. It is a pleasure to work with you and Bodie. You are on your way to making Bodie a happier dog and you too!

name: Desiree Perkins
text: Took my pup here for a few months and he seemed to love it. Came home exhausted each time as if he had a blast. As far as the friendliness of the staff, that was a hit or miss, honestly. I only interacted with one lady who I think may have been the owner that was really really sweet. Anyone else would come get my puppy from the car in the mornings, not say good morning or anything, just grab him and walk inside. I don’t know a single staff member’s name because no one ever introduced themselves to me. His very first day at daycare, he came home with scratches on his face from where he’d gotten into a fight with another dog. His second time at daycare, I got a call from one of the staff members there letting me know that he’d got bitten in the head by another dog & was asked if I wanted to come pick him up. I debated on not going back after that but decided to give it the benefit of the doubt. A few weeks later, my puppy contracts Kennel Cough from there which ultimately developed into pneumonia. As any other pet parent, I was angry because every dog is supposed to be fully vaccinated in order to attend there. $250 later, thankfully, he made a full recovery. I didn’t take him back for weeks because I was paranoid. However, I moved closer to the area and decided to give it another shot. Took him back on a Friday. A few days later, I notice he isn’t feeling well & end up having to take him to the emergency vet at 2:30 am. What have you know, Kennel Cough AGAIN. He’s been sick now for almost two weeks. Needless to say, I will not be returning to this facility. Ever.

resp.text:
Hello Desiree, thank you for reaching out to us with a review.  Our COVID Care protocols have definitely made it much more difficult for our staff to interact with our clients with conversations.  We have really missed these interactions too!  We do feel strongly that our curbside dropoff/pickup services as well as our staff wearing full PPE is in the best interest of our community, our clients, and our staff - but it has definitely left us missing those close interactions and relationship building with our clients.  I'm sorry you missed that too.  We are definitely learning how to best create relationships with our clients in the climate of COVID safety.  Your feedback will be very helpful as we continue to grow and change with these new and ever changing restrictions.

I'm also sorry to hear your pup got cough while he was participating in our services.  This particular strain of cough this year has actually made several national news stories as it has shown up all over the country.  It's been a nasty strain.  We worked very closely with our veterinary advisory team to be sure we were utilizing the absolute best practices in cleanliness and disinfectant protocols throughout our facility.  We also did our best to inform all clients honestly and openly about the outbreak.  We feel very fortunate that we were able to get it under control so quickly because of our amazing veterinary advisory team.  Just like childcare, dog daycare does pose a slightly higher risk of dogs getting upper respiratory infections and sometimes GI upset in group play.  We do our very best to inform our clients of this by having it clearly stated in several places on our General Client Agreement all clients receive and sign before their first day of daycare with us.  While we sincerely wish the bordatella vaccine required by our facility was able to protect against all cough, just like the human flu vaccine, it does not.

Again, we appreciate your feedback and wish you and your dog well and that you are able to find another facility that suits your needs.  Please let us know if we can help you with any pet care needs in the future.

name: Jordan Davis
text: I was really excited to get my dog Mallard into training at Roverchase. That excitement was short lived however when I registered online for the Orientation class online for $50 only to find out it doesn’t exist. My wife and I drove 40 minutes for the class and were then told the class didn’t exist and no one was there to train. So they took our name and number for the owner to call us and get us a refund. The owner did end up calling a week later from an unknown number and left a voicemail. I have subsequently called six more times to try to get ahold of the owner. Most of the time I was told she was out and would call me. She never called. On one occasion I spoke to the manager and he was going to call me back. Never called me back. At this point I guess I’m using this as a $50 life lesson to never pay ahead of time (despite their policy that the price goes up if you pay there). We will have to find another trainer to get our dog certified with Hand in Paw because I will not take our dog here. They had multiple chances to remedy the situation and we were understanding of the issue, but the lack of customer service and failure to even call back or refund us is unacceptable.

name: Jeremy Knezek
text:
This review only describes the Puppy Class and I have no other experience with this establishment. However, I found the classes to be ridiculously unprofessional. They charge the going rate, $20 per 1 hour class session for 4 sessions. However, the classes never start on time, the instructor is rarely prepared with her materials, generally she is looking at her phone several times per lesson and disappearing into another room, and 2 of 4 classes ended early. The instructor clearly knows how to train a dog, however this place has a business model based on you dropping your dog off for several weeks and a thousand or more dollars later they train the dog for you. I have no doubt she is exceptionally effective in that environment, but these classes where you learn to train your dog yourself are over complicated, incoherent, and lack any kind of structure. I feel like mostly they are used to get you to admit you need to drop your dog off with them, because that is the only way the dog will get trained. I've had better experiences with a big box store training, and that isn't saying much. There are significantly better training places for the same money with a whole lot less agenda. Hint: look for a non-profit dog obedience and training club.

Response to the owner: First off, it's labelled a rolling class. You don't need to offer "a missed class at no extra charge", that's part of it being rolling. You show up for 4 classes, whether they are consecutive or not, and I checked ahead of time to make sure that was the case. Second, in 3 of the 4 classes there was no socialization time unless you count the period of time we all waited in the office while the instructor was running late. Ending the class early twice ensured no socialization time. You offer 14 days of board and train for $1100 and 28 days for $2100. Both of those cost more than the thousand dollars I put in my review. So yes, you offer both cheaper and more expensive options, personally I think I hit the middle pretty well with my review. I put in my review you charge the going rate. I don't dispute that. I also said the trainer knows how to train dogs, the trainer simply didn't do much to help people learn to train their own dogs in this one class. Finally, the Birmingham Obedience and Training club is a non-profit club, they just aren't a charity. I find the vast majority of your response to my review to have been very misleading.

resp.text:
Hello Jeremy,
I'm sorry you didn't enjoy your Puppy Kindergarten class with us.  I am the owner of Roverchase and you have not contacted us in your 4 week training so, until this review, I was unaware of your unhappiness.  I have called the other puppies in your class period and they have all been exceptionally pleased and have all signed up for additional group classes for continuing education, so I am a bit confused.  I would be more than happy to talk with you about your experience.  I do know that your dog missed a week of Puppy Kindergarten and we were very happy to accommodate your schedule and allow you to makeup your missed class at no additional charge.     Puppy Kindergarten is a socialization and basic manners class and not a true "training skills" course.  This is very clear in the description of our class on our website as well as the materials given in each class period.  As mentioned previously, I would be more than happy to speak with you about your experience, please feel free to call the front office at 205-332-0203 and ask for Abigail.  Also, as a note, our day-training program is our most popular program but it is hardly "thousands of dollars."  Most of our clients spend between $250-450 for four weeks of all day training where they drop their dog of several times a week each week.  This is hardly "thousands of dollars" and is, in fact, some of the best prices is town.  Our Puppy Kindergarten class is also priced competitively with "the big box store" but you are taking this class from one of the most highly experienced and certified canine behavioral consultants in the city.  As an additional note, our prices are less expensive then the Obedience Club in our town, which is not non-profit.  Birmingham does not have a non-profit training club.

name: Bert Davi
text: Hard to find a place to trust with your four legged family members. This is that place for us highly reccomend

name: Kevin Auer
text:
I have gone through Roverchase group training which was fantastic. Aidan did a great job and took time to work on things that I specifically was having trouble with when there was not a big class. I took my dog to daycare and the owner, Abigail, stated that he was having trouble and recommended a behaviorist that comes to Roverchase every Thursday and Saturday. The price was $400 dollars which I was happy to pay because I really wanted the best for Blue (my dog). We talked with the behaviorist for about an hour and that was the end of the session. The behaviorist did not really teach or show me anything that I did not already know. The behaviorist did not even see the behavior that I was having trouble with but yet she was quick to write out a treatment plan. The behaviorist did say that I would need to do private lessons with Abigail which is not included in the cost. So for $400 dollars I talked to a lady for an hour. This is a big scam and I am really troubled that Roverchase would be a part of it.

My appointment lasted 1 hour. We left right after 5 and the appointment started at 4. So go back and check your cameras again. Yes, I was happy to pay the $400 dollars which I stated previously. But I was under the impression that I would get useful information and more than just talking to a "Behaviorist" for an hour. Again, how can she, the behaviorist, tell me what is the cause and real problem without even seeing the behavior. I even emailed the behaviorist trying to get a refund because that was not what I was expecting. Not even wanting a full refund because I understand that she did take time out of her day to meet with me. But I think she can keep the $80 dollars deposit and refund the $320 since I do not need her "expertise" any longer. But she has not responded to my email which she specifically stated was the best/fastest way to communicate with her. And as far as reviews need to be left honestly and in good faith...I did that. You decided to lie on your response by saying that you checked the cameras and that I was there for a little under 2 hours. Your cameras times are off or you lied. I told you that I actually loved Roverchase. I even recommended people go to y'all which only one of them did but one is better than none. But I do still think that I was scammed.

resp.text:
Dear Mr. Auer,
I’m so surprised to read your review regarding your experience with Blue and Dr. Beihunko, Roverchase, and the chain of events you described.  I appreciate you giving me the opportunity on this public platform to respond.
Firstly, I’m so glad you were pleased with your group classes at Roverchase with our trainer Aidan.  He’s so talented and our clients just adore him.  I’ll be sure to pass on your praise.  Thank you.
To address your concerns regarding your experience with Dr. Biehunko, I will do my best to address them in an organized fashion.
-  I recommended Blue see Dr. Biehunko when Blue presented to daycare last week after a 5 month absence from Roverchase.  Prior to Blue’s absence, we had discussed at length Blue’s increase reactivity and dog related aggression and you indicated you did not want to address it with us at that time but wanted to work with it on your own.  We advised against it.  When you presented last week, Blue came for a day of daycare and was significantly worse in all behaviors.  I recommended a consultation with Alabama’s only Veterinary Behaviorist, Dr. Biehunko.  I thoroughly explained how Dr. Beihunko’s consultations worked, that they were $400 and for that price you received a 1.5-2hr consultation with her expertise and she would make a diagnosis, a treatment plan, and then have 6 months of medical management and follow up.  I was very clear with you that there was no doubt that Blue would need additional lessons with me and that it would be at additional cost.  You remarked that you felt this price was fair for her experience and expertise and made your appointment for later in the week
- I do rounds with Dr. Biehunko each day for our shared clients.  She had already been thoroughly briefed on Blue’s behavior at Roverchase the day he returned as well as my notes from his behavior in December when we last saw him.
- Your consultation with Dr. Biehunko was just barely under 2hrs.  I checked the time stamp on our cameras
- In your consultation with Dr. Biehunko we were all very surprised to hear that you insisted that Blue has received no training outside of his training at Roverchase.  In fact, you insisted this was true even when specifically questioned about this by Dr. Biehunko and the Roverchase trainers who sat in on the session with you.  As I’m sure you know, it’s extremely difficult for any doctor to communicate effectively and efficiently with a client when that client willfully withholds pertinent information from that doctor that impedes the treatment plan.  As you can see from the attached screen shots, not only has Blue been in training with another trainer, but it was for the very issue he was presenting for.
- Finally, since your consultation was just over 72 hours ago, and we are very clear that treatment plans can take 2-4 weeks to become effective, it’s hard to understand how you can already be so unhappy with your results.
I certainly believe that pet owners are allowed to train and handle their pets as they see fit and that there are many fits available for many different preferences.  However, I hope we can both agree that reviews need to be left honestly and in good faith and this one has some glaring issues.  I hope, in light of this, and in light of you many months of happiness with Roverchase, you will consider removing it.  We certainly wish you and Blue only the very best and much success in all of your endeavors.

Best wishes,

Abigail Witthauer
Roverchase

text: I received my Wonderful PTSD Service Dog "Birch"  from them...It's funny that people complain that Rover Chase doesn't do what they say they do...
